page.title: 08Aircraft in the sky,New Deer
page.content: Living in central Buchan places one right beneath the flight paths of two categories of fairly noisey low- flying aircraft. The first category is that of {military aircraft.}The whole of this area is designated as a military low- flying zone with training flights on many days of the year. Common{NATO aircraft types seen over Buchan are the{Jaguar,Tornado,F111 and Buccaneer, with occasional visits made by{A10- {Thunderbolt,Canbera, Star-fighter}and {C130 Hercules. The second category is{oil-related {helicopter traffic. S61 Seaking, Puma, {S76, Tiger,and twin-rotor Chinook}are among the types of helicopter. From time to time there are complaints about the thud of rotors or roar of jets, but people are used to the noise and take no notice.
